hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{5}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{8}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f6fe059088d1e88ae48ef1174368c315117b5cc8)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{8}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{5}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40. Arrows point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9283c69d080035d0213443459189387d60477240)

$\blueD{8} \times \maroonD{5} = \underbrace{\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}}_{\blueD{8}\maroonD{\text{ fives}}}=\greenD{40}$

So $\maroonD{5}\times\blueD{8}=\greenD{40}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$5 \times 8 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]

![A number line labeled 0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40. Arrows point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2d19a769431d8d72a5f8b53dad98a0117df7044e)
